An armored man stands by the far wall, observing a more lightly-clothed woman as she busies herself with a handful of wires.

The room falls silent, and you find yourself the center of attention.
"We asked not to be disturbed. What are you doing here?" He grips his weapon and studies you closely.
"Sorry. They sent me here to take your drink order."
"Aren't you one of the Bardatto guards?"
"Persa? Zili mentioned you might know something about a Valera plan."
"Sorry, wrong room."
"Good. Now get lost." He jerks his head to dismiss you.
"Damn it, Persa! Part of our deal was that you keep your mouth shut."

"Well. That's the end of subtlety." 

Baer readies his weapon, his features hardening in a resolute expression.
"You look like you ought to be hauling wagons for a living. You expect me to believe you're a server here?"
"Yeah, well, we don't want anything. Get out."
"It's not my fault I'm built big, sir."
"I really need the money."

"Once is an accident. Twice and you're a little too nosy for your own good."

The sizable man balls his fist and cracks his knuckles.
"Relax, Baer. In and out - no complications."
"Relax? We're emptying a vault, not watershaping."
"Martino better come through with that boat he promised."
"I'm sure there's a dinghy in your future."
[Shrug] "You're right, that is pretty unlikely."
"You told me you weren't followed!"
"Zili is family! I told him so he wouldn't try to get involved or stand in our way."
[Attack] "Changed my mind."
Baer hefts his weapon to square off with you while Persa scrambles for cover.
"I hear the Valeras are moving against the Bardattos."
"You're dead wrong. We're just here to enjoy a drink and some privacy."
In spite of her calm tone, you note a bead of sweat running down Persa's forehead.
"Best for everyone involved that you don't go around making baseless accusations."
"Confess now before things get ugly."
"Ezzali can't know that I was here. Bad news for our new friend." He clenches his jaw and advances.
Baer eyes you warily, awaiting your reaction.
"Ezzali knows something's amiss. She sent me here."
"That's it, then. The plan's over, we're done. Time to pack it in." Persa sighs and folds her arms.
[Bluff/Lie] "I know you're after the adra! Your partner squealed. The jig is up."
[Bluff/Lie] "You're after the Bardatto vault, right? I want in."
[Attack] "I'm not taking any chances."
"My mistake."
[Bluff/Lie] "You want Ezzali dead, right? I can help."

"If she knew I was involved, my corpse would already be knocking against the pylons at the shipyard dock." 

Baer sets a focused glower upon you.
The two of them exchange a look. Baer laughs mirthlessly, shaking his head.
"Persa- what DIDN'T you blab about?!" Baer pierces her with a disapproving look.
"Get lost."
"I didn't... How did you..." Persa stammers, darting her gaze from Baer to you.
The pair exchange quizzical looks. Baer recovers first and shakes his head.
"I've had enough of this clown. Get out of the way, Persa." He rolls up his sleeves and advances.
"What kind of bloodthirsty idiots do you think we are?"
"This job's got too many moving pieces as it is. Safer if I push one of them off the board now."
"Try not to make too much of a mess, Baer. No need to draw even more unwanted attention."
"Baer, I don't know this one." She nods toward you.
"Just keep it down. There's someone out in the hall."
"We've no intent to disturb you. Please, carry on."
"If you won't leave, I'll make you leave."
[Attack] "The Bardattos send their regards."
